intro: Adinandra colombonensis, commonly known as the Colombian ironwood, is a rare and woody plant native to the mountainous regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments at higher elevations, often in cloud forests. It has small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, red berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
